alert.note: Alert for Elbert; Franklin; Hart (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 3:15AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Franklin, northwestern Elbert and southwestern Hart Counties through 345 AM EDT... At 315 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Carnesville, or near Royston, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hartwell, Royston, Bowman, Franklin Springs, Victoria Bryant State Park, Canon, Dewy Rose, Nuberg and Vanna. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
